page.title: 12CATAMARANS AND DOLPHINS
page.content: 'James Wharram Designs', on the old Devoran quays, are designers of sail- ing catamaran based on ancient Poly- nesian seagoing canoes. James Wharram was the first man to sail a catamaran across the North At- lantic from New York _ Dublin in 1959. Catamarans of his design visit the now dead port of Devoran before sail- ing to other ports in Britain, Europe and around the World. James Wharram is also heading a 'Dol- phin Link' team, studying the intelli- gent, social behaviour patterns of toothed cetacean - Dolphins, pilot whales and orcas. It will take many years before definite conclusions can be drawn about the intelligence level of cetacean. Is it less or the same as that of the higher primates, chimpan- zees or homosapiens?
